items.author: Liam Lacey
items.content: This is like no movie you've seen before, a haunting mixture of horror, history and fantasy that works simultaneously on every level.

items.author: Glenn Kenny
items.content: This intense film, a mix of horror, fantasy, and history that convinces on all those levels and mixes them up with dizzying brio, is a searing cinematic experience, a beautiful, terrifying vision from writer-director Guillermo del Toro.

items.author: J. Hoberman
items.content: Literally and figuratively marvelous, a rich, daring mix of fantasy and politics.

items.author: Ella Taylor
items.content: Pan's Labyrinth Like his terrific 2001 "The Devilâ€™s Backbone," Mexican horrormeister Guillermo del Toro's new movie offers us both real-life and fantastical monsters, and if you know his work, you won't waste time figuring out which to root for.

items.author: Michael Wilmington
items.content: A brilliant work of the imagination capable of truly seizing and igniting our fantasies.

items.author: Stephanie Zacharek
items.content: This is a true fairy tale, and one of the finest fantasy pictures ever made, but please do not take your young children to see it unless you want them to be scarred for life.

items.author: James Berardinelli
items.content: The lack of family friendliness does not diminish what del Toro has achieved with this magical motion picture.

items.author: David Ansen
items.content: Suspended between the brutally graphic and flights of lyrical fancy, Pan's Labyrinth unfolds with the confidence of a classical fable, one that paradoxically feels both timeless and startlingly new.

items.author: Ray Bennett
items.content: The performers are all good with Baquero poised and beautiful as Ofelia and Verdu vital and spirited as the rebellious Mercedes. Lopez gives an extraordinary performance as the bestial captain, an irredeemable villain to rank with Ralph Fiennes' Nazi in "Schindler's List."

items.author: Justin Chang
items.content: There's plenty of blood -- both literal and figurative -- coursing through the veins of Pan's Labyrinth, a richly imagined and exquisitely violent fantasy from writer-director Guillermo del Toro.
